QAPair.Question: What is (are) Peptic ulcer disease - discharge ?
QAPair.Answer: A peptic ulcer is an open sore or raw area in the lining of the stomach (gastric ulcer) or upper part of the small intestine (duodenal ulcer). This article describes how to care for yourself after you have been treated by your health care provider for this condition.

Question.qtype: when to contact a medical professional

QAPair.Question: Do I need to see a doctor for Peptic ulcer disease - discharge ?
